subject: Sexual Health
title: The HIV and AIDS Epidemic
description: A short lesson to help you apply The HIV and AIDS Epidemic.

hook.text: Since the 1980s, HIV has claimed over 40 million lives and reshaped public health infrastructure.

buildup.text: Sub-Saharan Africa was hit hardest, with some countries losing a generation of young adults.

discovery.text: Global campaigns expanded access to antiretroviral therapy, cutting AIDS deaths by more than half.

twist.text: Despite progress, nearly 40 million people still live with HIV today, and 1.3 million are newly infected yearly.

climax.text: Ending the epidemic requires reaching underserved communities with testing, treatment, and prevention.

punchline.text: Progress is real, but the fight is far from over.

quiz.question: How many lives has HIV claimed since the 1980s?
